trustDeed.details: Scottish Trust Deeds: 3 years+ since discharge for Vida 36/24/6, 1 year+ for Packager

debtManagementPlan.active: May be considered at underwriter discretion
requirements: Subject to satisfactory affordability
Subject to satisfactory conduct checks
debtManagementPlan.details: Debt Management Plans and Debt Arrangement Schemes may be considered at underwriter discretion

paydayLoans.details: Not specifically mentioned - likely considered as part of unsecured credit assessment

higherLTVRequirements.above85LTV: For Vida 24 and Vida 6 products, any LTV above 85% requires credit file up to date with no current arrears on major unsecured items
higherLTVRequirements.above90LTV: All LTVs above 90% require credit file up to date with no current arrears on major unsecured items (unsecured loans, hire purchases, store cards, credit cards, current accounts)

incomeCriteria.foreignNationalDetails: For Foreign National products where LTV is over 75%, one applicant must earn at least 50,000
incomeCriteria.employmentHistory: No minimum time in current employment, but applicants need to provide at least 3 months employment history

employed.requirements: Latest payslip, further information may be required upon assessment

fixedTermContract.requirements: Minimum 6 months remaining on contract at time of offer. Where less than 6 months, evidence of renewal/extension past 6 months must be provided

agency.requirements: Agency workers who have been with same agency for 12 months or more

contractors.weeklyRateCalculation: Weekly rate x 48 weeks for self employed
contractors.cisContractors: Using last years SA302/Tax calculations with TYOs, plus latest 3 months payslips/invoices OR latest 12 months CIS payslips/invoices
contractors.requirements: Day 1 contractors considered with minimum 1-year track record in same line of work. Minimum 3 months remaining on current contract (except Limited Companies)

selfEmployed.soleTrader: Latest 2 years SA302 and TYO OR Accountant's Certificate covering last 2 years OR 2 years accounts certified by qualified accountant
selfEmployed.partnership: Latest 2 years SA302 and TYO OR Accountant's Certificate covering last 2 years OR 2 years accounts certified by qualified accountant
selfEmployed.limitedCompany: Accountant's Certificate covering last 2 years OR 2 years accounts certified by qualified accountant. If not 100% shareholder and only accounts provided, also require last 2 years SA302s
selfEmployed.tradingLessThan2Years: Evidence of income for 1st year and either projection for current year from qualified accountant OR latest 3 months business bank statements
selfEmployed.oldProofOfIncome: If latest proof older than 12 months (but no more than 18 months), latest 3 months Personal and Business Bank Statements also required
selfEmployed.acceptableIncome: Sole traders/partnerships: most recent share of net profit if stable or increasing. Limited Co Directors: salary and dividends. Net profit after tax for 100% shareholders

types: Income from 2nd jobs (3 months record + last 3 payslips)
Child Benefit (where each applicant <60k, for children 11 years at application)
Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) - Income and Contribution
otherIncome50Percent.note: Not as main source of income. Benefit income should not typically be considered main source

propertyRequirements.exLAFlatsMinValue: 80,000 outside Greater London, 200,000 within Greater London
excludedTypes: Properties outside mainland England, Scotland, Wales

flats.maxStoreys: No maximum limit on number of storeys in a block subject to Valuers comments on mortgageability and saleability

aboveCommercial.restricted: Up to 60% LTV for flats above/adjacent to restaurants, takeaways, dry cleaners, hairdressers, launderettes, tattoo, piercing, nail parlours, public houses and petrol stations

leasehold.capitalRepayment: Minimum 40 years remaining at end of mortgage term

newBuild.builderIncentive: Acceptable up to 5% of purchase price

rightToBuy.calculation: Lower of 100% of discounted purchase price or 75% of open market value
requirements: Section 125 or RTA 3 from Local Authority/Housing Association
Last 12 months rental payments (missed payments treated as missed mortgage payments for tier allocation)
rightToBuy.description: Purchase only applications from Local Authorities for Right to Buy and from Housing Associations for Right to Acquire

eligibleRelations: Parents (including stepparents and parents of spouse)
jointBorrowerSoleProprietor.howItWorks: Only borrowers named on title deeds occupy property as main residence. Family member(s) live elsewhere. All jointly and severally liable

foreignNationals.standardRange: EU/EEA/Swiss with Pre-Settled/Settled status or Indefinite Leave to Remain eligible for standard products up to 97% LTV
foreignNationals.foreignNationalRange: Other acceptable visas use Foreign National product range up to 90% LTV
foreignNationals.depositRequirement: 5% of deposit must come from applicant's own funds (savings or inheritance) for Foreign National range

requirements: Applicant under 50
Over 10 years from retirement
Contributing to pension scheme
lendingIntoRetirement.calculation: Can lend to age 80 based on current income where above 3 requirements met. Additional applicants outside this can be considered but no income used for affordability. Repayment must be Capital & Interest

giftedDeposit.requirements: Form confirming no interest in property and will not reside at property. May require evidence of balance in UK bank account with donor's name and address

benefits: Free valuation on properties up to 500k

3AndEasy97LTV.description: 97% LTV products with Fee Saver options

overpayments.withERC: Up to 10% in any rolling 12-month period

remortgage.within6Months: Considered even within 6 months since purchase or last remortgage, subject to underwriter discretion

purchaseAtUndervalue.conditions: Acceptable where purchasing from close relative, or long term tenant buying from landlord

directorsLoan.conditions: Self-employed applicants only. Confirmation from Accountant required that loan will not adversely affect business

overseasDeposit.conditions: Deposits from overseas account considered on case by case basis

fees.feeOptions: Product fees can be added to loan above max LTV except 97%. Interest only up to 75% LTV including fees

applicationCriteria.ageDetails: 21 years at application and up to 80 years at end of term
applicationCriteria.maritalStatus: Cases submitted in joint names where married, civil partnership, co-habiting, financial dependency, or if partners providing monies. Sole applications for married couples on remortgages when property already in sole name
applicationCriteria.residentialStatus: 3 years address history. Latest year must show continuous UK residency
applicationCriteria.termRequirement: Any products with fixed rate 5+ years, 1 extra year must be applied to term (e.g. 5yr fixed needs 6yr term, 7yr fixed needs 8yr term)
applicationCriteria.repaymentMethod: Capital and Interest or Interest Only (Interest Only up to 75% LTV, max 1m)
interestOnlyVehicles: Cash ISA or other regular savings
applicationCriteria.offerValidity: 4 months. New Build offers valid 6 months

deposits.savings: Proof required in all instances - statement showing balance to monthly statements evidencing build up
deposits.gifted: Accepted from close relatives (see giftedDeposit in specialFeatures)
deposits.purchaseAtUndervalue: Where purchasing from close relative or long term tenant from landlord
deposits.governmentSchemes: Where SEISS, CBILS or BBLS used, proceeds cannot be used for deposit

requirements: Name of certifier
Date (no more than 3 months old)
Signature of certifier (digital acceptable)
Job title and company stamp if not intermediary
documentCertification.statementPhoto: I certify this is true copy of original document, and photo is true likeness
documentCertification.statementNoPhoto: I certify this is true copy of original document

packagers.packagerTier: Exclusive tier available only through packager partners for higher adverse cases
packagers.tierDetails: Packager tier accepts defaults/CCJs <6 months, 1+ year bankruptcy/IVA discharge, 3+ years repossession

productTiers.description: No CCJs or defaults in 24 months, 0-1 mortgage arrears in 36 months
No CCJs or defaults in 24 months, 0-1 mortgage arrears in 36 months (same as Tier 1 with slightly higher rates)
Up to 2 defaults in 24 months (max 1,500 in 12 months), 1 CCJ in 24 months (max 1,000 in 12 months or 2,500 in 24 months), 1-3 mortgage arrears in 36 months

Up to 2 defaults in 24 months (max 1,500 in 12 months), 1 CCJ in 24 months (max 1,000 in 12 months or 2,500 in 24 months), 1-3 mortgage arrears in 36 months (same as Tier 3 with slightly higher rates)
Up to 5 defaults in 24 months, up to 3 CCJs in 24 months, 1-3 mortgage arrears in 36 months - highest adverse acceptance

ccjs.exclusion: Defaults, CCJs or secured arrears recorded 3 months before application are not accepted

defaults.exclusion: Defaults, CCJs or secured arrears recorded 3 months before application are not accepted

mortgageArrears.exclusion: Defaults, CCJs or secured arrears recorded 3 months before application are not accepted

unsecuredArrears.notes: Not counted but may affect credit score

bankruptcy.notes: Not mentioned in criteria - assumed not accepted

iva.notes: Not mentioned in criteria - assumed not accepted

dro.notes: Not mentioned in criteria - assumed not accepted

satisfied.notes: If satisfied more than 36 months ago, can be considered up to 95% LTV

active.notes: If in an active or satisfied DMP less than 36 months ago, can be considered up to 85% LTV. DMPs must have been active for a minimum of 12 months. No minimum period of activity for satisfied DMPs.

debtManagementPlan.debtArrangementScheme: Debt Arrangement Schemes (DAS) accepted and treated in the same way as a Debt Management Plan (DMP)

adverseCreditCriteria.creditScoring: All products are subject to internal credit scoring

acceptedTypes: Right to Buy properties (England only, houses only, not flats)

newBuild.notes: Purchase and remortgage limited to 85% LTV

studioFlats.notes: Purchase and remortgage limited to 70% LTV

fundingOptions: Up to 90% of discounted purchase price (plus lender fees)
Up to 100% of discounted purchase price (plus lender fees)
rightToBuy.ltvCalculation: Loan doesn't exceed 75% of open market value as determined by panel surveyor

debtConsolidation.notes: Remortgages with debt consolidation limited to 90% LTV

cashback.notes: Available on 0 fee products with valuation refund

assessmentFee.notes: Standard valuation and assessment fee is payable on application for all products. The amount charged includes both fees. The valuation fee is refundable if the valuation is not carried out.

applicationCriteria.maxAgeNotes: Max age 75 where proof of retirement is supplied

interestOnly.notes: Value of repayment vehicle at application must cover the interest only loan amount (inclusive of fees) at mortgage term end

partAndPart.notes: Interest only element cannot exceed 50% LTV

reversionRates.notes: BBR reversion rates have a floor. If BBR falls to 0.00% or less, rate payable will be 0.00% plus the agreed set percentage above BBR. Rate will never go below 0.00% plus the additional percentage rate.

Standard residential range with no maximum loan amount - accepts some adverse credit
For clients with more adverse credit history including discharged bankruptcy and IVA
Up to 100% of share value for shared ownership properties

All CCJs/defaults satisfied more than 12 months prior to application regardless of date of registration

mortgageRentArrears.notes: In last 12 months not normally accepted but may be considered subject to individual case assessment

unsecuredArrears.notes: Not counted but may be considered on case-by-case basis as part of full underwrite

iva.notes: IVA/bankrupts who have been discharged over 3 years ago and who have no residual debt may be accepted subject to individual case assessment

bankruptcy.notes: IVA/bankrupts who have been discharged over 3 years ago and who have no residual debt may be accepted subject to individual case assessment

multiSourceIncome.notes: 100% of secondary income considered in many scenarios. Accept multi-source income from employment, self-employment or combination of both

selfEmployed.yearTwoProjection: Can work on projection for year two based on uplift of up to 30% of first year's figures

professionalLandlords.notes: Accept earnings from professional landlords as full time income source

complexIncome.notes: Complex income sources understood and considered

newlyQualifiedProfessionals.notes: Options with no maximum loan amount at 90% LTV helping newly qualified professionals

locations.notes: Available in England and Wales only

cashPurchaseRemortgage.notes: Properties bought for cash and renovated to increase value can be considered for remortgaging within 6 months of ownership providing this can be fully evidenced

highNetWorth.notes: For high net worth clients, options available with no maximum loan amount. Complex income sources such as sportspersons, musicians and actors are understood and considered

commonSenseApproach.description: Willingness to consider cases that fall outside of standard criteria and ability to be flexible with income multiples
commonSenseApproach.bespokeSolutions: Business development managers empowered to provide tailored solutions even if case doesn't fit standard criteria

portability.notes: Products are portable. If client moves home during initial deal period, remaining benefits (up to outstanding balance of existing mortgage) can be transferred to new mortgage, subject to lending criteria. ERC not charged but existing rate won't apply to additional funds borrowed

productFees.notes: Option to add fees available on shared ownership products

fees.overpayments: Payments up to maximum of 499.99 per month can be made without incurring early repayment charge

applicationCriteria.maxAgeNotes: Maximum age at end of mortgage term is 85

sharedOwnership.notes: Shared ownership products only available on repayment basis

reversionRates.notes: On expiry of fixed rate product, mortgage will revert to variable rate above Bank of England Base Rate (BBR) for remainder of loan. Rate will move up and down in line with BBR but if BBR falls below 0.00% rate charged won't change
